morla.title: RDF Documents
morla.subtitle: How to create graphs about our RDF Documents

section.p: A RDF Document is a graph. Sometime it is useful to see these RDF Document like a graph into a image. Morla can create these images and it opens them with the default image viewer of your operating system You can change the image viewer into the preferences window.
The menu graph contains some options to the graph creating. You can create graph of the current RDF Document, merge more documents in a single graph image, and a lot of other stuff.
The preferences flags permit you to change colors, sizes, forms and any other elements of the image graphs.
Morla uses graphviz to create the image files. If you want, morla can generate a source code written in the graphviz's syntax. This option is, of course, into the graph menu.
